intro: Canthium leytense, commonly known as the Leyte spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows in moist, lowland areas and has alternate, simple, ovate leaves. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. The fruit is a three-lobed capsule that contains small, hard seeds.
